title: Republicans debate - as it happened - BBC News
summary: eleven republican 2016 candidates hold a fiery debate in simi valley , california .
businessman donald trump has come under attack from all sides .
trump refused to apologise over comments about the wife of jeb bush .
biggest applause went to carly fiorina , when she responded to a recent jibe by mr trump over her looks .

documents.title: goodnight !
text: that concludes our coverage of tonight 's gop debate .
be sure to stick with us throughout election season for updates and continued coverage .
caitlin frazier
caitlinfrazier
194 minutes later , we 're out .
194 minutes later , we 're out .

documents.title: love for the iron lady
text: margaret thatcher was a very divisive figure in the uk , but not so across the atlantic , where her popularity has endured decades after she left office .

documents.title: secret service code names
text: the candidates have been asked a playful question : if you 're elected president , what would you want your secret service code name to be ?

documents.title: jeb bush would put margaret thatcher on the $ 10 bill
text: jeb bush is probably going to regret this later : asked which woman he 'd put on the $ 10 bill , he responded `` margaret thatcher . ''
that 's not an american !

documents.title: trump : `` autism has become an epidemic ''
text: mr trump says he is pro-vaccine , but wants them administered over longer periods of time .
he said he thinks giving babies vaccines can make them sick and lead to autism .
ben carson responded that trump 's assessment makes him `` an ok doctor '' and said there is no link to autism from vaccines .
rand paul agreed that people should be able to give children vaccines in smaller doses at once .

documents.title: rand paul talks marijuana
text: `` the war on drugs has had a racial outcome , '' said rand paul .
states should decide for themselves what drugs are legal , he argued , and said it 's not fair to want to put poor people in jail for smoking marijuana .

it 's a a 21-gun salute on the south lawn '' of the white house .

documents.title: outsiders
text: all of the candidates are vying to claim the mantle of being a political `` outsider '' .
the idea of being a fresh face plays well in american politics - especially in the republican party .
chris christie of new jersey cited the fact that he was a republican in a heavily liberal state , while carly fiorina took a slightly more poetic approach .

documents.title: pre-debate reading
text: if you have n't had a chance yet , be sure to read our preview of the debate - there 's still about 10 minutes left .
hello and welcome to the bbc 's live coverage of the second republican presidential debate .

eleven of the republican party 's top contenders are squaring off at the ronald reagan presidential library in southern california , with real estate magnate donald trump both in the lead and preparing to come under attack .
we 'll be updating this page in real-time with the big developments , fast analysis and the top trends across social media .
with just under a half-hour until the sparks fly , you can
